Bug.Summery: Forum Archives - please remove read-access password-protection

Lines.Line: a) "Archive eclipse mailinglists additionally on gmane.org" [read-only-nntp-acess]
b) "Provide write-access to eclipse mailinglists via gmane.org"
b) allow anyone to scan posts and extract e-mails
- newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups
- web access to mailing list archives

Bug.WithStack:
The eclipse website provides several forum archives [mailinglists, newsgroups].
It is a common practice within open-source projects, to have those archives open to the public (without the need of a registration).
This simplifies referencing, collaboration, archival within search-engines [thus content appears as search reslut e.g. within google] etc.
Please remove the read-access password-protection to the archives and html-nntp-forums (which serve as an archive, too) on eclipse.org.
-
Example for the eclipse forum archives:
html-forum archive, which has a convenient threaded view: http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=32944&group=eclipse.platform
same message within the mailing-list-style archive: http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform/msg32969.html
Both are not accessible without registration. The reason behind the password protection is to prevent spambots from retrieving the e-mail address of the poster.
This tool: http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform/msg32969.html
conceals the identity fo the poster in an acceptable fashion, but do we really want to hide that information? As it is, the information is open and public to whomever wants to access it.
I agree with the web master. I have used my real e-mail address, under assumption the groups are password protected. We cannot change the rules down the road. Otherwise I would request all my post to be deleted. Please have the gentleness to not "RESOLVE WONTFIX" reports thus early.
I'll comment on the comments to a later point.
Thank you I am closing this issue, and I will be advising the EMO via the eclipse.foundation newsgroup. The same userid/password is required to read the newsgroups, post articles and read the archives, and has been so for a long time. The entire community has come to know this procedure and to rely on it to protect themselves from unwanted spam. Once more I ask you friendly, to not "RESOLVE WONTFIX" this Issue as to leave it open [as it is], thus it can be discussed, researched, voted etc.
I've no problem to discuss it partly within the newsgroup - but this is my personal decision.
I'll give further comments soon.
[note to readers: see the Bugzilla field "URL" above for a link to the relevant news-thread]. -1,
As Konrad mentions in Comment #2, many uses their corporate email when posting on those groups relying on the fact that they are password protected (which stops most automatic systems to harvest email addresses for spam).
It also stops the normal newsgroup spam that many other newsgroups ends up having if one can post anonymously.
I agree with ilias, this bug should remain open. Having password protected mailing list and newgroup archives deters casual users / developers that want to participate. There are ways to obfuscate email addresses so that spam harvesters will not be able find any email addresses. This is very much an infrastructural problem with eclipse.org.
The folks at gmane.org have a good setup that you might want to investigate (read the Encryption section):
http://www.gmane.org/tmda.php
Maybe eclipse.org should just use gmane rather than try to maintain your own archives. Comment 6: "It also stops the normal newsgroup spam that many other newsgroups ends up having if one can post anonymously. "
this is valid, but off-context [I don't ask to remove write-access password-protection]
-
Comment 7: *exclusive* external archival on gmane
eclipse should maintain own archives, to allow full in-site-operation.
an *additional* external archive is of course worthfull. [but gmane has several problems]
I'll shortly post the summary. ilias, I intended the comment about gmane to be a suggestion. I personally find the mail to nttp gateway ideas to be very handy and I use it for all of my list viewing except for lists on eclipse.org. I'm looking forward to seeing the list of problems.
“Eclipse Webmaster”, I emailed webmaster@eclispe.org on September 1, 2004 asking for this feature. Mike Milinkovich (Executive Director, Eclipse Foundation) responded and indicated that part of the problem was that email addresses within messages were not concealed. An example of this can be seen in this message:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-swt-dev/msg03792.html
Once again, I have to say this is an infrastructural problem with eclipse.org. Red Hat's mailing list archiving software seems to be able to handle this type of situation. This message shows an example:
http://www.redhat.com/archives/fedora-list/2004-November/msg09099.html
Mike also mentioned that this issue would be looked into after the eclipse website was moved. IIRC, this happened a few weeks ago.
BTW, it would be nice if you used your real name so we know who we are talking to. Comment 9: Please do not increase complexity whilst interweaving issues.
This Issue is about "enable open read-access to eclipse internal forum archives", and affects mailinglists and newsgroups.
gmane is an external archive - and operates only on mailinglists.
I suggest you to proceed in two steps (file an Issue): a) "Archive eclipse mailinglists additionally on gmane.org" [read-only-nntp-acess]
After the read-access is done: b) "Provide write-access to eclipse mailinglists via gmane.org"
[Let me know if you need assistance or if I should file the issues for you. ]
I will comment then within the new issues.
-
"BTW, it would be nice if you used your real name so we know who we are talking to." "ilias" is my real name. In conjunction with my email adress, you have all information that I like to provide you. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=79556#c10 "ilias" is my real name."
I am certain he was refering to "Webmaster."
Bugzilla does expose the mail addresses I believe. How was this concern avoided there? Comment 11. You are right, he's refering to the WebMaster's real name. My apology, I've overseen this.
[Bugzilla: no special action is taken, emails are exposed, which is natural.]
I'll post shorty a preliminary Summary. Preliminary Summary from forum discussion: http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=172&group=eclipse.foundation
-
ilias wrote: [...] > GOALS: > - Simplify Referencing > - Simplify Cross Foundation Collaboration > - Enable archival within search engines etc. (e.g. google) > - current eclipse users can search additionally within google > - newcomers can hit on eclipse due to a technical google-search > - Open Source - Open Resource > > I think that goals are worthfull. > > COUNTERS: [...] > => { read-password prevents emails from spambot-retrieval } > => { existing password protection was reason to use real email } > => { [critical] rules cannot be changed down the road } [...]
> The simple conclusion is: > > To achieve the above mentioned GOALS, an email protection mechanism must be provided, which does not rely on an read-access-limitation.
The simplest way would be to configure the existent software:
[At this point, I like to mention once more that those _very_ essential resources are not publically available within a CVS, thus team-members can contribute to their enhancement.]
-
Newsgroup html-gateway "newsportal", used as archive:
http://florian-amrhein.de/newsportal/doc
-
Mailinglist / Newsgroup archive
uses: MHonArc 2.5.0
a newer version is available:
http://www.mhonarc.org
SPAMCONTROL:
http://www.mhonarc.org/MHonArc/doc/resources/spammode.html This bug is a little hard to follow, but I would like to try to revive it. It is currently very awkward to refer to newsgroup and mailing list posts because of the password protection. Specifically, this comes up when dealing with developers on IRC, developers from other projects, or with people who have bugzilla accounts but may not wish to register for a newsgroup password.
Since pretty much every other open source project I have ever been involved with has open mailing list archives, it would be very nice to see this on eclipse.org as well. Obfuscating email addresses of web-accessible archives is common practice, and many software tools seem to handle this job nicely. The bug is definitely not dead, and I too want to remove the password protection. I will get around to it, it's just a matter of time.
Right now migrating the Eclipse infrastructure to the new hardware is proving to be a formidable task. While migrating eclipse.org to the new hardware infrastructure, I have started to ensure that e-mail addresses are obfuscated throughout our applications so that, if need be, we can remove passworded access to web-based resources such as the mailing list archives and the web-based newsgroup portal (passwords would remain on the newsgroups themselves).
For instance, if you use the latest NewsPortal on Eclipse, I have removed mail links and have replaced domain names with x's : http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/thread.php?group=eclipse.newcomer http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=1219&group=eclipse.newcomer#1219
Denis +1 for removing the password protection :) I'd like to suggest removing the password protection from the following resource:
- Web access to newsgroup archives
The sender's e-mail address in this resource are mangled. However, if the message itself contains e-mail addresses, they are left open.
The following resources should be kept password-protected, and for the reasons listed:
- newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups (news server does not mangle e-mail addresses)
- WebPortal access to the newsgroups (to have a consistent rule with the newsreader access ... Wanna post to an eclipse newsgroup? get a password)
- web access to mailing list archives (although the sender's e-mail address is mangled, several e-mail addresses in the messages are not mangled as a result of replying to an e-mail)
This is a pretty high-impact item, and I'd like your feedback. I believe having our newsgroup archives indexed by search engines would be a definite plus, and could offer some encouragement to the community to post questions and answers in the groups rather than in the mailing lists.
Thanks Mangling email addresses, even those in the body of the message, does not seem to be a problem for GNU mailman. See the user's signature in this post, for example:
http://mail.gnome.org/archives/desktop-devel-list/2004-October/msg00159.html
It would be really great to have these archives more easily accessable (the releng list in particular is one I reference alot, but cannot provide links to). (In reply to comment #19) > Mangling email addresses, even those in the body of the message, does not seem > to be a problem for GNU mailman. See the user's signature in this post, for > example:
Actually, they're using MHonArc 2.6.10, the same version I recently upgraded eclipse.org to. Looking at this archive, generated yesterday, it seems this is specific to the new version of MHonArc, because e-mail addresses in our own archives are also mangled:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse-dev/msg07014.html
I would probably just have to regenerate the archives for all the lists at some point.
But if we start with removing passwords from newsgroups, that would be a step in the right direction, right? yes :)
BTW, how does Google Groups handles newsgroups? I'm in the process of regenerating the mailing list archives and the newsgroup archives. The newer version of MHonARC we're using supports mangling e-mail addresses in the body of the messages, but archived messages need to be re-created for this.
Once the archives are re-created, I'll switch the links to the new archives and remove the password protection from both archives, allowing Google and others to index that content while preserving your SPAM protection.
This will be a definite win for the entire community.
Any comments or questions are by all means welcome. (In reply to comment #22) > Once the archives are re-created, I'll switch the links to the new archives and > remove the password protection from both archives, allowing Google and others to > index that content while preserving your SPAM protection.
Awesome! Thanks for doing this.
It's done. Passwords have been removed from the mailing list archives and the news archives. No more exquisitus. To ensure your e-mail addresses were protected, even the ones embedded in the message text, I needed to regenerate all the archives. As a result, some message numbers have changed, so some links will be broken (or won't point to the right posting). But it's for a better cause, right?
It's only a matter of time before search engines start picking up all this new content. Denis, thanks very much! In comment #18 you mentioned passwords would not be removed from: - newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups - WebPortal access to the newsgroups - web access to mailing list archives
It sounds like you removed passwords from the last one which was ok because of mangling. How about the first two? (In reply to comment #26) > In comment #18 you mentioned passwords would not be removed from: > - newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups > - WebPortal access to the newsgroups > - web access to mailing list archives > > It sounds like you removed passwords from the last one which was ok because of > mangling. How about the first two?
If I remove the password protection from the news server (outlook, thunderbird) itself I'd be a) allowing posts from anyone b) allow anyone to scan posts and extract e-mails
If I remove the password protection from the news portal I'd be a) allowing posts from anyone
Unauthenticated posting sounds like a bad idea to me. Case in point: e-mail.

"BTW, it would be nice if you used your real name so we know who we are talking to." "ilias" is my real name. In conjunction with my email adress, you have all information that I like to provide you. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=79556#c10 "ilias" is my real name."
I am certain he was refering to "Webmaster."
Bugzilla does expose the mail addresses I believe. How was this concern avoided there? Comment 11. You are right, he's refering to the WebMaster's real name. My apology, I've overseen this.
[Bugzilla: no special action is taken, emails are exposed, which is natural.]
I'll post shorty a preliminary Summary. Preliminary Summary from forum discussion: http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=172&group=eclipse.foundation
-
ilias wrote: [...] > GOALS: > - Simplify Referencing > - Simplify Cross Foundation Collaboration > - Enable archival within search engines etc. (e.g. google) > - current eclipse users can search additionally within google > - newcomers can hit on eclipse due to a technical google-search > - Open Source - Open Resource > > I think that goals are worthfull. > > COUNTERS: [...] > => { read-password prevents emails from spambot-retrieval } > => { existing password protection was reason to use real email } > => { [critical] rules cannot be changed down the road } [...]
> The simple conclusion is: > > To achieve the above mentioned GOALS, an email protection mechanism must be provided, which does not rely on an read-access-limitation.
The simplest way would be to configure the existent software:
[At this point, I like to mention once more that those _very_ essential resources are not publically available within a CVS, thus team-members can contribute to their enhancement.]
-
Newsgroup html-gateway "newsportal", used as archive:
http://florian-amrhein.de/newsportal/doc
-
Mailinglist / Newsgroup archive
uses: MHonArc 2.5.0
a newer version is available:
http://www.mhonarc.org
SPAMCONTROL:
http://www.mhonarc.org/MHonArc/doc/resources/spammode.html This bug is a little hard to follow, but I would like to try to revive it. It is currently very awkward to refer to newsgroup and mailing list posts because of the password protection. Specifically, this comes up when dealing with developers on IRC, developers from other projects, or with people who have bugzilla accounts but may not wish to register for a newsgroup password.
Since pretty much every other open source project I have ever been involved with has open mailing list archives, it would be very nice to see this on eclipse.org as well. Obfuscating email addresses of web-accessible archives is common practice, and many software tools seem to handle this job nicely. The bug is definitely not dead, and I too want to remove the password protection. I will get around to it, it's just a matter of time.
Right now migrating the Eclipse infrastructure to the new hardware is proving to be a formidable task. While migrating eclipse.org to the new hardware infrastructure, I have started to ensure that e-mail addresses are obfuscated throughout our applications so that, if need be, we can remove passworded access to web-based resources such as the mailing list archives and the web-based newsgroup portal (passwords would remain on the newsgroups themselves).
For instance, if you use the latest NewsPortal on Eclipse, I have removed mail links and have replaced domain names with x's : http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/thread.php?group=eclipse.newcomer http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=1219&group=eclipse.newcomer#1219
Denis +1 for removing the password protection :) I'd like to suggest removing the password protection from the following resource:
- Web access to newsgroup archives
The sender's e-mail address in this resource are mangled. However, if the message itself contains e-mail addresses, they are left open.
The following resources should be kept password-protected, and for the reasons listed:
- newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups (news server does not mangle e-mail addresses)
- WebPortal access to the newsgroups (to have a consistent rule with the newsreader access ... Wanna post to an eclipse newsgroup? get a password)
- web access to mailing list archives (although the sender's e-mail address is mangled, several e-mail addresses in the messages are not mangled as a result of replying to an e-mail)
This is a pretty high-impact item, and I'd like your feedback. I believe having our newsgroup archives indexed by search engines would be a definite plus, and could offer some encouragement to the community to post questions and answers in the groups rather than in the mailing lists.
Thanks Mangling email addresses, even those in the body of the message, does not seem to be a problem for GNU mailman. See the user's signature in this post, for example:
http://mail.gnome.org/archives/desktop-devel-list/2004-October/msg00159.html
It would be really great to have these archives more easily accessable (the releng list in particular is one I reference alot, but cannot provide links to). (In reply to comment #19) > Mangling email addresses, even those in the body of the message, does not seem > to be a problem for GNU mailman. See the user's signature in this post, for > example:
Actually, they're using MHonArc 2.6.10, the same version I recently upgraded eclipse.org to. Looking at this archive, generated yesterday, it seems this is specific to the new version of MHonArc, because e-mail addresses in our own archives are also mangled:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse-dev/msg07014.html
I would probably just have to regenerate the archives for all the lists at some point.
But if we start with removing passwords from newsgroups, that would be a step in the right direction, right? yes :)
BTW, how does Google Groups handles newsgroups? I'm in the process of regenerating the mailing list archives and the newsgroup archives. The newer version of MHonARC we're using supports mangling e-mail addresses in the body of the messages, but archived messages need to be re-created for this.
Once the archives are re-created, I'll switch the links to the new archives and remove the password protection from both archives, allowing Google and others to index that content while preserving your SPAM protection.
This will be a definite win for the entire community.
Any comments or questions are by all means welcome. (In reply to comment #22) > Once the archives are re-created, I'll switch the links to the new archives and > remove the password protection from both archives, allowing Google and others to > index that content while preserving your SPAM protection.
Awesome! Thanks for doing this.
It's done. Passwords have been removed from the mailing list archives and the news archives. No more exquisitus. To ensure your e-mail addresses were protected, even the ones embedded in the message text, I needed to regenerate all the archives. As a result, some message numbers have changed, so some links will be broken (or won't point to the right posting). But it's for a better cause, right?
It's only a matter of time before search engines start picking up all this new content. Denis, thanks very much! In comment #18 you mentioned passwords would not be removed from: - newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups - WebPortal access to the newsgroups - web access to mailing list archives
It sounds like you removed passwords from the last one which was ok because of mangling. How about the first two? (In reply to comment #26) > In comment #18 you mentioned passwords would not be removed from: > - newsreader (outlook, thunderbird, etc) access to the newsgroups > - WebPortal access to the newsgroups > - web access to mailing list archives > > It sounds like you removed passwords from the last one which was ok because of > mangling. How about the first two?
If I remove the password protection from the news server (outlook, thunderbird) itself I'd be a) allowing posts from anyone b) allow anyone to scan posts and extract e-mails
If I remove the password protection from the news portal I'd be a) allowing posts from anyone
Unauthenticated posting sounds like a bad idea to me. Case in point: e-mail.

and takes 1% of total execution time

Bug.Summery: NPE in class WorkingSetModel
Bug.WithStack:
Using I200411240800
Got a NPE in class WorkingSetModel: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.workingsets.WorkingSetModel.<init>(WorkingSetModel.java) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage$PackageExplorer.createPartControl(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage$PackageExplorer.<init>(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java:760) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.createControl(JavaProjectWizardFoldersPage.java:1441) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard.createPageControls(Wizard.java:179) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createPageControls(WizardDialog.java:605) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createContents(WizardDialog.java:496) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:375) at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog.create(Dialog.java:983) ...
because 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is null when invoking method init.
'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' will only be initialized when using the second constructor. Fixed for M5. The updater is initialized as a isde effect to adding the working set to the manager. verifying... hard to verify without steps... but here comes my manual static analysis:
- 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is only initialized upon receiving a CHANGE_WORKING_SET_UPDATER_INSTALLED property change.
- In the 0-arg-ctor, a new IWorkingSet with ID OthersWorkingSetUpdater.ID is created, which trigger such a property change *if* the OthersWorkingSetUpdater is freshly created, but not otherwise.
Since WorkingSetModel seems to be the only place where an IWorkingSet is created with said Id, this is probably safe, as long as there is just one WorkingSetModel. (Lemma 1)
- In the 1-arg-ctor restoring from an IMemento, restoreState is called on the local working set manager, triggering the same AbstractWorkingSetManager.internalAddWorkingSet call that results in said property change event.
PackageExplorerPart seems to manage the singleton instance of WorkingSetModel, which ensures that never two Models exist at the same time. (Lemma 2)
-> Given 1 & 2, I believe this is fixed :-)
Bug.WithOutStack:
Using I200411240800
Got a NPE in class WorkingSetModel:
...
because 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is null when invoking method init.
'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' will only be initialized when using the second constructor. Fixed for M5. The updater is initialized as a isde effect to adding the working set to the manager. verifying... hard to verify without steps... but here comes my manual static analysis:
- 'fOthersWorkingSetUpdater' is only initialized upon receiving a CHANGE_WORKING_SET_UPDATER_INSTALLED property change.
- In the 0-arg-ctor, a new IWorkingSet with ID OthersWorkingSetUpdater.ID is created, which trigger such a property change *if* the OthersWorkingSetUpdater is freshly created, but not otherwise.
Since WorkingSetModel seems to be the only place where an IWorkingSet is created with said Id, this is probably safe, as long as there is just one WorkingSetModel. (Lemma 1)
- In the 1-arg-ctor restoring from an IMemento, restoreState is called on the local working set manager, triggering the same AbstractWorkingSetManager.internalAddWorkingSet call that results in said property change event.
PackageExplorerPart seems to manage the singleton instance of WorkingSetModel, which ensures that never two Models exist at the same time. (Lemma 2)
-> Given 1 & 2, I believe this is fixed :-)

Bug.Summery: should be a public method for starting a rerun action
Bug.WithStack:
hi, you should provide a public method for starting the rerun action from the api instead of using InternalSearchUI.getInstance().runAgain(iSearchQuery);! will have a look. I added NewSearchUI.cancelQuery and fixed runQueryInBack/ForeGround to allow running the same query twice.
That means you can now easely reimplement the rerun action yourself > 20041221 thank you!
Bug.WithOutStack:
hi, you should provide a public method for starting the rerun action from the api instead of using InternalSearchUI.getInstance().runAgain(iSearchQuery);! will have a look. I added NewSearchUI.cancelQuery and fixed runQueryInBack/ForeGround to allow running the same query twice.
That means you can now easely reimplement the rerun action yourself > 20041221 thank you!

Bug.Summery: Provide a consistent time zone display
Bug.WithStack:
When importing log files that contain times from different time zones, the log viewer will display the offset from GMT for each different time zone. Prefer to have an option to have the viewer normalize all display times to a single timezone....it is awkward, for example, to do the mental time arithmetic to determine whether 12:48:00 -04:00 is earlier or later than 13:11:00 +01:00. Sizing 4pw Eugene to share the work with Alex; Eugene 3pw, Alex 1pw Please open a related feature (if not already opened) for the import wizard (also GLA) to allow the user to specify a time zone (whith default the local time zone) for logs that doesn't contain time zone info. Changing to P1 as per the 4.1 official plan. The implementation of the first part of the feature (as in description) contains a exra 'display time zone' field in preference page to let user select a display time zone and given user selection, log(CBE) related views will be using the time zone for displayed.
second part as requested by Marius in comment #2 is independent of the original feature. it's more link to feature bug 74918, where timezone support in GLA and support by logParser extension pt. (feature bug 50681). user will be selecting timezone in wizard and be passed to GLA when generating CBEs.
feature checked in Documentation request 106658 opened As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: tooltip formatting
Bug.WithStack: Possibility to include basic markup in the tooltip text. Something like Something.setToolTipText("Formatted tooltip example") Sorry, the native tool tips for the operating systems do not support html. If you really need this, you can build your own tool tips and use the browser widget. See the SWT snippets for examples of how to code your own tool tip.
Bug.WithOutStack: Possibility to include basic markup in the tooltip text. Something like Something.setToolTipText("Formatted tooltip example") Sorry, the native tool tips for the operating systems do not support html. If you really need this, you can build your own tool tips and use the browser widget. See the SWT snippets for examples of how to code your own tool tip.

Bug.Summery: Add tracing support to all layers for data collection and communication components
Bug.WithStack:
Users of the RAC/agent communication layer have complained that there is no tracing support to help with debugging communication problems between the RAC and agent. This tracing support should be added so that it can be turned on at run time, for example via an environment variable. Tracing will likely have to be done to a file. Tracing should be added to RABindings.c and the File pointer could be stored in ra_agenthandle_t. Contact Dave Smith. not contained in 4.0, moving to 4.1 as P1 This is targeted for new agent controller. Here are some clarification on this request with Dave Smith:
- this tries to aid the debugging on the agent side (mainly named pipe but shared memory would be a nice addition).
- because the AC will support multiple instances on the same system, the environment variable may not work well. The suggestion is to make it configurable in the AC configuration file: AGENT_COMM_TRACE = YES/NO AGENT_COMM_TRACE_FILE = trace.log
In the future, if we need dynamic configuration, this could be converted in to an AC command at run time.
The single log will contain traces for all agents (with proper agent id tags)
- The main communication activities that are need to be logged are in "RABindings.c" and "hcbnd.c"
Here is the summary of the effort:
- impact to the configuration reading and setting
- named pipe and shared memory operations will be traced
Sizing:
- two weeks to write up the design, review and approve by the community (especially what type of and how much info should be traced, and the format of the trace records, probably using CBE) . The design will appy for any transport layer (e.g. socket is included)
- one week of coding and testing
I expanded the scope to cover tracing for client, agent controller, and base agent layers. Changed the title to reflect the expanded scope. See this URL for latest sizing and design issues: http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/groups/Architecture/documents/features/hf_79564.html
*** Bug 97159 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This feature should also provide a configurable logging facility for Agent Controller and agents.
For increased serviceability of the new Agent Controller code and all C/++ and Java agents written for the new Agent Controller, provide a configurable logging facility with the following capabilities (analogous to JSR-047 or Java Logging):
-Level filtering for different uses (e.g. loggers). -Configurable sinks (e.g. handlers) for different uses (e.g. loggers) that can be configured based on logging level. -File and Logging Agent sinks (e.g. handlers). -Configuration for file sinks (e.g. handlers) to limit the total amount of storage resource consumed by the log file files (e.g. rollover). -Common Base Event support.
Changing to P1 as per the 4.1 official plan. Reassigned to Andy. From defect #80013:
The new org.eclipse.hyades.logging.native native Common Base Event implementation should be used to reinstrument the existing log message in the Data Collection Engine for increased PD capabilities (e.g. viewing, filtering, sorting, analysis, correlation). This includes:
-Port the existing instrumented log messages (e.g. ra_logServiceMessage()) to log native Common Base Events including a situation and source component ID.
-Instrument new log messages for all types of situations:
-Start -Stop -Connect -Configure -Request -Feature -Dependency -Create -Destroy -Report -Available -Other
See fix for defect https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=79657 for an illustrative example of Common Base Event logging in C/++. The basic logging support is in place for the Agent Controller and agents. I still need to look into the code and make sure the logging service is actually being called at the appropriate places.
A few other loose ends need to be tied up, such as logging from shared libraries, client logging, and filtering based on a configured log level. The logging framework has been put in place for the new Agent Controller. I have opened new bugzilla reports to capture the remaining effort to round this out more fully. These new items are: 111943, 111946 and 111947 As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Users of the RAC/agent communication layer have complained that there is no tracing support to help with debugging communication problems between the RAC and agent. Tracing should be added to RABindings.c and the File pointer could be stored in ra_agenthandle_t. Bug.Summery: Allow for filtering (simple string or attribute/property-based) at the sensor extractor level
Bug.WithStack:
Allow filtering at the sensor and extractor level of the GLA to improve GLA performance. Will provide more details soon. need to think more on this and break it down into a set of requirements based on a use case. Theme: Scaling Up
By reducing the amount of data that is parsed by the Parser component using regular expression parsing, the overall performance of GLA will be improved.
Further Description of Requirement:
The requirement is to allow the sensor or extractor to filter out lines or data that are not of interest, based on rules specified by the adapter writers and/or users. More details of the use cases is required to size this feature. This new feature needs to be added to the documentation.
New messages will likely be required.
The GLA Editor will need to be regenerarted with new fields added to the GLA schema. Candidate for 4.2 After reviewing the design, here are my comments in upper case: Use-case 1 (static, parser writer filtering) ... It is REQUIRED that the OSSingleFileSensor AND ANY OTHER GLA SENSORS/EXTRACTORS FROM TPTP currently included with TPTP GLA be changed to support regex filter specification as part of this feature. If both the filter specification and filter exit class is specified in the adapter, then the filter specification is passed to the filter exit class which then tests the log line based on the filter specification. Created attachment 34557 Patch containing GLA code changes for this feature Committed code changes for this feature, as indicated in the attached patch file, to TPTP Head CVS.
The associated doc and GLA editor regeneration work will be completed under defects 127425 and 127428 respectively. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: NPE when closing JUnit compare view

Lines.Line: - When double clicking a failed tests that threw a ComparisonFailure you can see

Bug.Summery: When having two workbenches open, an attached agent in one, will show up in the attach wizard in the other

Lines.Line: 1. Open two workbenches running at the same time.
2. Attach to an agent in one of the workbenches.
3. Go to the attach wizard in the other workbench, the agent shows up, but

Bug.WithStack:
(Same as bug 79214, but for 3.0.2)
1. Open two workbenches running at the same time. 2. Attach to an agent in one of the workbenches. 3. Go to the attach wizard in the other workbench, the agent shows up, but should not.
The agent does not show up if we go to the attach wizard in the same workbench where we attached to the agent.
I also tested this with an older Hyades driver (20040830_2107). I saw the same issue.
----
This is causing crashing in higher products when two users attempt to monitor the same agent. This is a must-fix. Please do not target these defects. Defects are targeted as part of a approval process. Once the committers have agreed this is a must fix for 3.0.2 before it be targeted. Otherwise, its runs the risk of slipping under the radar and either not being communicated or not fixed. Fix is to be done by the UI team va bug 79214. The isAttach(boolean) method is already implemented in the 3.0.2 stream.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79214 *** reopen for UI fix in 3.0.2 approved for 3.0.2 Fix submitted to 3.0.2. Verified. Closing bug.
Bug.WithOutStack:
(Same as bug 79214, but for 3.0.2)

Bug.Summery: GLA should log events to a file when importing a local log into LTA
Bug.WithStack: This feature requests that GLA log any event that is requested by the logging level settings of the adapter configuration, to a file, be it hgla.log or some other file, when running in an Eclipse environment (not sure why this restricition is being made by Dave) This would be useful for debugging an local log import failure. The adapter file could be modified to set the logging level to a lower level to capture informational and tracing events. Contact Dave Smith. This feature work was done in Hyades 3.2. I am told this has been done in 3.2 so I am closing it. This work was done in 3.2 iteration 2

The adapter file could be modified to set the logging level to a lower level to capture informational and tracing events. Contact Dave Smith. This feature work was done in Hyades 3.2. I am told this has been done in 3.2 so I am closing it. This work was done in 3.2 iteration 2

Bug.Summery: [Managed Build] Importing 1.2 projects with libraries/library search paths fails
Bug.WithStack:
Importing a 1.2 project into 2.1 when there are libraries and library search paths fails because of an ID element that was not accounted for. Fixed in 2.1 and head. Retargetting to 2.0.3 because it has a different converter, so we need to track the bug until it can be checked/translated to that stream. Added a boundary condition test to handle the slightly odd 1.2 option ID format for these linker options. The converter now does the right thing in 2.0.X, 2.1, and HEAD. Failed in CDT 2.0.3 build 200502022231
The fix work for Libraries.
But, it fails for Library Search Paths As per Mathieu's comments this is still failing for part of the defect. I will re-open the defect. Leo, I hope that you don't mind that I assigned this to you :-) Mathieu, how important is this defect? I don't think it is very important. P3
If you have a Library Search Path in a 1.2.x CDT project, it will disappear when it will be upgraded to a CDT 2.0.x project. It doesn't look like this is too important. It only affects people migrating from 1.2 and they can manually re-add the path. I am marking this as WONTFIX. If someone needs this, feel free to re-open the defect.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Importing a 1.2 project into 2.1 when there are libraries and library search paths fails because of an ID element that was not accounted for. Fixed in 2.1 and head. Retargetting to 2.0.3 because it has a different converter, so we need to track the bug until it can be checked/translated to that stream. Added a boundary condition test to handle the slightly odd 1.2 option ID format for these linker options. The converter now does the right thing in 2.0.X, 2.1, and HEAD. Failed in CDT 2.0.3 build 200502022231
The fix work for Libraries.
But, it fails for Library Search Paths As per Mathieu's comments this is still failing for part of the defect. I will re-open the defect. Leo, I hope that you don't mind that I assigned this to you :-) Mathieu, how important is this defect? I don't think it is very important. P3
If you have a Library Search Path in a 1.2.x CDT project, it will disappear when it will be upgraded to a CDT 2.0.x project. It doesn't look like this is too important. It only affects people migrating from 1.2 and they can manually re-add the path. I am marking this as WONTFIX. If someone needs this, feel free to re-open the defect.

Bug.Summery: [KeyBindings] registry: Keybinding problems after converting according to deprecation warning

Lines.Line: - create new Java file in new Java project
- place caret in the middle of a non-empty line
-> the line wrapped at the caret position, rather than a new line would have
been created below the caret line
-> the line wrapped at the caret position, rather than a new line would have
been created above the caret line
-> nothing happens rather than the previous word would have been deleted
-> nothing happens rather than the next word would have beed deleted
- This happend when we removed the deprecations in the command extensions in
our xml files. This might be unrelated.
- My original comment talks about 'goto next/previous word'. This is wrong.
- The command extension point description should point out valid values for
the attributes. This is currently not the case.
- Attribute value 'CR' rather than 'Enter' is not a good choice. The key we
refer to is 'Enter' or 'Return' not 'CR' or 'LF' or 'CRLF'.
I ran in a similar problem when I used M1 in the deprecated 'keySequence'
(instead of 'string') attribute: both attribute descriptions do not mention M1
but only 'string' supports M1. An explanation could be that M1 has been added
with 3.0 but this is not visible for the reader of the extension point doc.
Therefore the doc should either list the possible values for the deprecated and
the new attribute or list which values are new and not supported by the
*** Bug 79890 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Regarding comment #8. You have them backward: string is deprecated and
keySequence is the current practice. I've added notes to the schema about the
syntax that is expected for modifier keys.
Regarding comment #7. I see that you have not made the changes suggested in
comment #1. This is why those keys don't work. Now, looking at the "delete"
commands, it also appears that it is "Backspace" instead of "BS". I've added
notes to the schema about the syntax that is expected for special keys and
If you feel that we should support Backspace and Return and Enter, then please
re comment 8: yep I mixed them (hacked it in too fast).

Bug.WithStack:
Build I200411240800 + HEAD of text + jdt ui projects
After converting our extensions for the command extension point according to the deprecation warnings there are some key bindings that do not work any longer. Note, the conversion might also be an coincidence but is the only obvious change in the area.
Although the following actions have key binding definitions in the XML, they do not show up on the key bindings perference page any longer. They also don't work. - insert line above current line (org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.smartEnterInverse) - insert line below current line (org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.smartEnter)
The following two actions used to work without explicit key binding definitions, but don't do so any longer: - go to previous word (org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.goto.wordPrevious) - go to next word (org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.goto.wordNext)
In both cases, adding the key bindings explicitly using the preference page brings them back to life. "Ctrl+CR" and "Ctrl+Shift+CR" will work a bit better than "Ctrl+ENTER" and "Ctrl+Shift+ENTER". Also, you might want to consider "M1+CR" and "M1+M2+CR". This is equivalent to saying "Command+CR" and "Command+Shift+CR" on MacOS X, and "Ctrl+CR" and "Ctrl+Shift+CR" on every other platform.
Could you be more precise about the "wordPrevious" and "wordNext" problem? In both the previous revision and the current revision, there were explicit bindings to those commands. Can you give steps to reproduce the problem you're seeing?
The keybinding definitions read as follows - could it be that the definitions need to be in upper case?
-- snip --
<keyBinding keySequence="Ctrl+Arrow_Right" contextId="org.eclipse.ui.textEditorScope" commandId="org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.goto.wordNext" keyConfigurationId="org.eclipse.ui.defaultAcceleratorConfiguration"> </keyBinding> <keyBinding keySequence="Ctrl+Arrow_Left" contextId="org.eclipse.ui.textEditorScope" commandId="org.eclipse.ui.edit.text.goto.wordPrevious" keyConfigurationId="org.eclipse.ui.defaultAcceleratorConfiguration"> </keyBinding>
As I said, these key bindings work for me. I don't understand what you mean by not work. Could you explain a bit more, please?
Line 183 of KeyStroke converts the token to upper case before doing the comparison. hm, seems that after doing the following conversions, the Arrow_Left/Right bindings work again (of course I don't have a plausible explanation for this):
Enter -> CR Delete -> DEL Backspace -> BS I still don't see the problem, but if you're happy.... *** Bug 79817 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I20041130: - open new workspace - create new Java file in new Java project - place caret in the middle of a non-empty line - press Shift+Enter -> the line wrapped at the caret position, rather than a new line would have been created below the caret line - undo - press Ctrl+Shift+Enter -> the line wrapped at the caret position, rather than a new line would have been created above the caret line - undo - press Ctrl+Backspace -> nothing happens rather than the previous word would have been deleted - press Ctrl+Delete -> nothing happens rather than the next word would have beed deleted
There are a couple of issues: - This happend when we removed the deprecations in the command extensions in our xml files. This might be unrelated. - My original comment talks about 'goto next/previous word'. This is wrong. Should have been 'delete next/previous word'. - The command extension point description should point out valid values for the attributes. This is currently not the case. - Attribute value 'CR' rather than 'Enter' is not a good choice. The key we refer to is 'Enter' or 'Return' not 'CR' or 'LF' or 'CRLF'. I ran in a similar problem when I used M1 in the deprecated 'keySequence' (instead of 'string') attribute: both attribute descriptions do not mention M1 but only 'string' supports M1. An explanation could be that M1 has been added with 3.0 but this is not visible for the reader of the extension point doc. Therefore the doc should either list the possible values for the deprecated and the new attribute or list which values are new and not supported by the deprecated attribute. *** Bug 79890 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Regarding comment #8. You have them backward: string is deprecated and keySequence is the current practice. I've added notes to the schema about the syntax that is expected for modifier keys.
Regarding comment #7. I see that you have not made the changes suggested in comment #1. This is why those keys don't work. Now, looking at the "delete" commands, it also appears that it is "Backspace" instead of "BS". I've added notes to the schema about the syntax that is expected for special keys and non-printable ASCII keys.
If you feel that we should support Backspace and Return and Enter, then please open a separate bug. re comment 8: yep I mixed them (hacked it in too fast).
*** Bug 80206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Verified by inspection of the schema included with the build. I20041214-2000.

This might be unrelated. - My original comment talks about 'goto next/previous word'. This is wrong. Should have been 'delete next/previous word'. - The command extension point description should point out valid values for the attributes. This is currently not the case. - Attribute value 'CR' rather than 'Enter' is not a good choice. The key we refer to is 'Enter' or 'Return' not 'CR' or 'LF' or 'CRLF'. I ran in a similar problem when I used M1 in the deprecated 'keySequence' (instead of 'string') attribute: both attribute descriptions do not mention M1 but only 'string' supports M1. An explanation could be that M1 has been added with 3.0 but this is not visible for the reader of the extension point doc. Therefore the doc should either list the possible values for the deprecated and the new attribute or list which values are new and not supported by the deprecated attribute. *** Bug 79890 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Regarding comment #8. You have them backward: string is deprecated and keySequence is the current practice. I've added notes to the schema about the syntax that is expected for modifier keys.
Regarding comment #7. I see that you have not made the changes suggested in comment #1. This is why those keys don't work. Now, looking at the "delete" commands, it also appears that it is "Backspace" instead of "BS". I've added notes to the schema about the syntax that is expected for special keys and non-printable ASCII keys.
If you feel that we should support Backspace and Return and Enter, then please open a separate bug. re comment 8: yep I mixed them (hacked it in too fast).
*** Bug 80206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Verified by inspection of the schema included with the build. I20041214-2000.

Bug.Summery: Support for bookmarking events
Bug.WithStack:
This function is to allow bookmarking of events and then look in the bookmark list to go to the selected event. There will be a visual indicator on the bookmarked event. There will be a bookmark list which can be accessible from the UI which will contains the bookmarked events. The user will pick the event from that list and the UI will scroll to the bookmarked event. This is applicable for both the Log View and the Log Correlation view not contained in 3.3 so moving to 4.1 as P2 This should be done using Eclipse capabilities, there is already work in progress to enable markers at logical resource/elements level, so we could use that support for any kind of markers including bookmarks in all our views not only log related views.
My point is that we should follow the Eclipse support and try to make sure that would be ready when we need to enable this in TPTP. We might run into problems if the eclipse mechanism is too editor-oriented (if I remember it correctly..) but I agree we should use this mechanism if we can. Deferring from 4.1 as per the official 4.1 enhancement plan. http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/featureplans/features.php?source=All&project=All&release=4.1&file=TPTPFeatures_4.1.xml
Please set version to 4.2 update priority per Chris's request Setting target to future so it doesn't show up in the 4.2 feature query. Closing requests older than 2 years; please reopen if this is still valid Closing.

Bug.Summery: (MON) Format the converted CBE message so that is not in one line
Bug.WithStack:
Format the converted CBE message so that is not in one line. It is currently difficult to read Please provide more detail on this defect.
The EventFormatter class contains APIs to generate CBE XML fragments both formatted (e.g. indentation/new lines) and unformatted (e.g. one line). Is this defect related to the EventFormatter APIs or some other applications using these APIs. Paul, this is an enhacement request for the GLA formatter to select what type of formatting it wants to use. Need more information: What is the scenario for reading the CommonBaseEvents? From a file? In the editor? After finding out more information on this feature I am returning it. The problem to be solved by this feature is that some CommonBaseEvent field values shown in the Log View are missing newline characters so the data is shown as one line when it should be shown as multiple lines as in the original log file.
This behaviour is caused by the GLA adapter file used to parse the log file. The Extractor rule includes the replaceLineBreaks="true" and specifies some other symbol to replace the line breaks. This is working as designed. This problem can only be fixed by modifying the adapter file to not specify replaceLineBreaks="true" or to add substitution rules to put the newline characters back into the data (ie replace the new linebreak symbol with real newline characters).
Therefore there is no GLA code changes required. The owner of the adapter file will be asked to fix the problem. agreed. Investigated for 4.1 The investigation work to determine the details of this 4.1 feature was done in 3.3 iteration 1 timeframe. The result of the investigation was that the feature request was invalid.

Bug.Summery: GLA to auto set CBE sequence number
Bug.WithStack:
Provide a function in the GLA parser blade that will automatically set the sequence number field of the CBE if there is more than one message with the same timestamp to preserve the original logging sequence from the log file. Theme: Simple to use
This feature is providing functionality to make GLA more complete and accurate. That is, it enables GLA to generate CommonBaseEvents that automatically have correct sequence numbers. Retargetting as per discussions with submitter. Candidate for 4.2 Targetting to iteration 1. Committed changes to TPTP Head CVS.
A new class called SequenceNumbersByTime was created to store the sequence numbers base on timestamps. I changed both the CBEFormatter and the abstract accecc and error log classes to use this new class for setting sequenceNumber in the CommonBaseEvent objects. Therefore, support was added for both rules-based and static parsers.
Files changed:
org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.formatters.CBEFormatter org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.util.SequenceNumbersByTime org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.AbstractAccessLogParser org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.AbstractErrorLogParser org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.Parser As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: [Commands] request: Declare a command for "Link with Editor"
Bug.WithStack:
I200411240800
Platform/UI should declare a retargetable toggling action/command for "Link with Editor". Currently, almost every decent view that shows editable elements has its own view toolbar button "Link with Editor". I would like to toggle these buttons via a keyboard shortcut (and the shortcut should be the same in every view :-).
I'm not sure whether this should go into to the IDE or the RCP layer, but I'm sure you'll find a good place. Supporting a key bindings does not require defining a retargetable action, just a command. This should go in the IDE, not the generic workbench. The Navigator's Link with Editor action should use it too.
There are a few others like this too (e.g. Collapse All).
Nick: arguably, anything to do with global actions could now be considered the domain of commands. Either we should eliminate the [GlobalActions] component area, or all the "[Commands] request:" should be reassigned to [GlobalActions]. I suggest we keep [GlobalActions] to mean any actions defined globally by the IDE.
Moving Dougs bugs There are currently no plans to work on this feature.
PW
I find myself pushing the "link with editor" button of the package explorer (twice) quite frequently. Really what I want when I do this is to just get some context for the open editor. I suspect that's the root of the original request here as well. Perhaps we should investigate mechanisms to provide that context and then implement a command (and keybinding) for it.
As part of the conversion for bug 154130 we should make this a command.
PW
(In reply to comment #6)
Mike, I think your use case is not exactly the subject of this bug.
This bug requests a retargetable "Link with Editor" action that should work when a view is active and that view supports linking to the editor input -- in fact just a keybinding for all the existing view toolbar actions.
I guess what you need is "Navigate > Show In > ..." . E.g. when you want to reveal the current java editor input, press "Alt+Shift+Q P". For shorter shortcuts, see bug 38789.
AFAICS, this bug does not need any new support form the commands framework -- it's simply a matter of declaring the command (and maybe a retargetable action). > press "Alt+Shift+Q P" ...
That's funny: Pressing "Alt(er...Command)+Shift+Q" on the Mac means "exit all apps and log out".
> That's funny: Pressing "Alt(er...Command)+Shift+Q" on the Mac means "exit all > apps and log out".
Oops, sorry for my monotheistic advice ;-). And it was the wrong command anyway. The "Alt+Shift+Q *" shortcuts ("Command+Option+Q *" for carbon lifeforms) only open a view.
The right shortcut for "Show In" is "Alt+Shift+W *" (which translates to "Command+Option+W *" on the Mac). (In reply to comment #8) > I guess what you need is "Navigate > Show In > ..." . E.g. when you want to > reveal the current java editor input, press "Alt+Shift+Q P". For shorter > shortcuts, see bug 38789.
I have the Package Explorer open all the time and this really does nothing for me if it's already opened (besides having the workbench switch to that as my active part). The scenario described by McQ in comment #6 is exactly the same thing I go through everyday. I use Open Resource and Open Type all the time and I'd really just like a hotkey for 'Link with Editor' so that I can quickly my Package Explorer will scroll to where it needs to be.
If we need to declare a new command, let's do that. If we need to write a new retargetable action too, let's do that too!
Paul, let me know if you want some help with this. If you can point me to the right places, I'll see if I can brew up a patch. :) Remy, the 2 "bits" we can easily do in the platform are create a Link With Editor command and change the resource navigator so that the nav action uses the correct action definition id.
I would suggest putting the command in org.eclipse.ui to make it available to all editors (since they must all have an IEditorInput) although I'm not adamant about that.
PW
Created attachment 77847 Patch to add a 'Link with Editor' command.
I set the binding's category to be 'In Windows' although I'm not sure if that's what's desired. The key binding works if you're in the Navigator view but nothing seems to be happening if I'm in an editor? (In reply to comment #13) > Created an attachment (id=77847) [details] > Patch to add a 'Link with Editor' command. > > I set the binding's category to be 'In Windows' although I'm not sure if that's
I would go with the navigate category for the command.
> what's desired. The key binding works if you're in the Navigator view but > nothing seems to be happening if I'm in an editor?
That's because we activated the handler for the Resource Navigator.
To have it work for editors we would have to write a default handler that toggled the navigator link preference. But that would work for the Resource Navigator only ... in order to get it to work for the PackageExplorerPart we would need to make it key off of the same preference. Then anybody else that wanted to take advantage of the command would also have to key off of that preference.
PW
Note that JDT defines a "Show in Package Explorer" command. I normally unbind Ctrl+P from Print and bind it to this instead. It has the advantage of not being a toggle (unlike Link with Editor). Released to HEAD >20071130
I included the Project Explorer action as well as the Resource Navigator one.
PW
In I20071211-0010 PW

To have it work for editors we would have to write a default handler that toggled the navigator link preference. But that would work for the Resource Navigator only ... in order to get it to work for the PackageExplorerPart we would need to make it key off of the same preference. Then anybody else that wanted to take advantage of the command would also have to key off of that preference.
PW
Note that JDT defines a "Show in Package Explorer" command. I normally unbind Ctrl+P from Print and bind it to this instead. It has the advantage of not being a toggle (unlike Link with Editor). Released to HEAD >20071130
I included the Project Explorer action as well as the Resource Navigator one.
PW
In I20071211-0010 PW

Bug.Summery: [5.0] JavaModel: Method parameter type is not marked as type variable

Lines.Line: - Create the folloing code in a selfhosting workspace and open it in the editor
- set a break point in JavaElementLabels.getMethodLabel where the parameter
types are printed (change the method name to force a refresh)
- The signature of the type parameter is 'QT;' which marks the type as an
unresolved type. Should it be a type variable 'TT;'?

Bug.WithStack:
20041126
- Create the folloing code in a selfhosting workspace and open it in the editor - set a break point in JavaElementLabels.getMethodLabel where the parameter types are printed (change the method name to force a refresh) - The signature of the type parameter is 'QT;' which marks the type as an unresolved type. Should it be a type variable 'TT;'?
public interface Test<T> { void foo(T t); } This would require performing some resolution, which it doesn't. Qnames are meant to represent all unresolved type names.
Bug.WithOutStack:
20041126
- Create the folloing code in a selfhosting workspace and open it in the editor - set a break point in JavaElementLabels.getMethodLabel where the parameter types are printed (change the method name to force a refresh) - The signature of the type parameter is 'QT;' which marks the type as an unresolved type. Should it be a type variable 'TT;'?
public interface Test<T> { void foo(T t); } This would require performing some resolution, which it doesn't. Qnames are meant to represent all unresolved type names.

Bug.Summery: Provide facility to rearrange lifeline in log interactions views.
Bug.WithStack:
This is a follow up of Bug 56570 on log interactions views.
Sébastien Veyrière: ' In order to enable the "rearrange feature", you need to call "SDWidget.setReorderMode(true)" in your loader. The user will then be able to rearrange the lifeline using a Drag and Drop gesture. Two new methods have been added to allow the loaders to maintain the reodering consistency when the pages change or when a previously reodered diagram is restored
- SDWidget.getLifelineReoderList: this method return an ArrayList which represents the reoder sequence performed by the user. Each arrayList element is of type Lifeline[2] with Lifeline[1] inserted before Lifeline[1] in the diagram (Of course, each ArrayList element must use the same Lifeline reference than the one stored in the frame using Frame.addLifeline) -Frame.reorder(ArrayList): This method programmatically reoders the frame (the parameter and comment regarding reference are the same than for getLifelineReoderList)
A "Drag and Drop collapsing" feature has also been add. By default this feature is disabled. If you when to use it in your loader, you just have to implement the ISDCollapsingProvider and set it in the SDView. Your Collapsing provider will then be called back when the user will request two lifelines to be merged using a Drag and Drap gesture.' Deferring from 4.1 as per the official 4.1 enhancement plan. http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/featureplans/features.php?source=All&project=All&release=4.1&file=TPTPFeatures_4.1.xml Not in plan for 4.4; Moving target to future Due to lack of resources this enhancement request is resolved as WONTFIX. Please feel free to reopen if you consider it's a required enhancement. Closing. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As such, TPTP is not delivering enhancements. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement is resolved as WONTFIX. For this enhancement to be considered, please re-open with an attached patch including the Description Document (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/description_documents.html), code (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/resources/TPTPDevGuide.htm), and test cases (see http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/TPTP_Testing_Strategy.html).

Bug.Summery: [FastViews] Double-clicking search result closes fast-view

Lines.Line: (i.e. close on double-click) makes it painful to browse the results, as each
time I open one in the editor, the view is closed.
1) Stepping through results (basically, what you do with the down/up arrows in
the search results view). Used when just browsing code, for example.
2) Find a result and go work at that location (i.e. find a call site and fix the
3) Step and work repeatedly. The case would be where you have to fix something
at twenty different call sites of a method.

Bug.WithStack:
Version: 3.1.0 Build id: 200411240800
When using the search view, I like to click on my search results to open an editor with the place in the code where they have been found. But I also like to have the search results configured as a fast view, so that they disappear automatically once the view loses focus. But the current behaviour of fast views (i.e. close on double-click) makes it painful to browse the results, as each time I open one in the editor, the view is closed.
The behavior I would like to have is as follows: Clicking (or double-clicking, doesn't matter...) on a search result should show the result in the editor, but not close the search view. The search view should only be closed when it loses focus (e.g. when I click on the editor to actually work with something I found). This would allow to effectively browse the results, inspect the code and still using the advantage of the fast view, which is that it disappears when I'm done browsing and move to editing. This used to work in 2.1.x (old) Search.
Either new search broke this or the open methods changed slightly when switching to new look and/or RCP.
I seem to remember that we actually decided to make "step next" (via the arrow buttons) leave the focus on the search view (and thus not close the fast view), and to move the focus on double click (and close the fast view). Another thing you could do is set the open mode to single-click: this will leave the Search view open for most editors. Yes with single-click (sc) mode it seems to work. But in double-click (dc) mode, what's the rationale then behind closing the view on dc? AFAIK a sc in sc mode should have the same semantics as a dc in dc mode, which is to open the selection. So something in dc mode seems to be broken.
It seems to be a general (platform) rule that double click should open a editor and give focus to it what hides the fast view. That's convenient for people having the fast view over the editor area.
I personnaly don't like this behaviour as I have a perspective arrangement where the editor is fully visible also when a fast view is open. Browsing through resoluts would be nice but is not really possible with the current rule.
It's probably a bug that single click has a different behaviour than double click.
Moving to platform. Make this configurable? Or hide the fast view only if the focus view is really under the fast view? This is a zombie bug. It's been killed a couple of times already but it keeps coming back :-). I think we're looking at 3 interaction modes here:
1) Stepping through results (basically, what you do with the down/up arrows in the search results view). Used when just browsing code, for example. 2) Find a result and go work at that location (i.e. find a call site and fix the call to do something else). 3) Step and work repeatedly. The case would be where you have to fix something at twenty different call sites of a method.
I think 1 and 2 are well covered by the current functionality. How about we have a "show next result" action in the editor, which selects the next search result in the search results view and sets the focus on the search results view (it doesn't have to be contributed by the editors, just available in the editors, e.g. something global). The user could then use the search result keys (or just enter) to get to the next result (in the editor). Am I making sense? Hmm, this doesn't really cover my use-case. I want to have random-access to all the results, else why would I need the search results view at all? Often for example I search for references to a class to see how it is used by other people. I might get quite a bunch of matches from which I want to inspect a subset which seems interesting to me. I actually never even use the 'next' and 'previous' buttons, they don't fit my workflow.
Now you should minimize all the views except the one containing the search view. This allows the behavior you're asking for (and the Search view won't 'mask' the editor that you're looking at.

Bug.Summery: [prefs] Helping users with change listeners
Bug.WithStack:
With the new structure when users are interested in preference change events, they must register a listener on the node that they are interested in, as well as a node change listener on the parent node to re-add their listener in case the node is removed.
We should help users with their listeners. Currently the listeners are stored on each node but we should investigate having a registry which perhaps keeps listeners around across the life-cycle of nodes. We will leave the change listeners on the nodes. We experimented with moving them to a registry and had problems. See bug 89262.
Bug.WithOutStack:
With the new structure when users are interested in preference change events, they must register a listener on the node that they are interested in, as well as a node change listener on the parent node to re-add their listener in case the node is removed.
We should help users with their listeners. Currently the listeners are stored on each node but we should investigate having a registry which perhaps keeps listeners around across the life-cycle of nodes. We will leave the change listeners on the nodes. We experimented with moving them to a registry and had problems. See bug 89262.

Bug.Summery: [browsing] Java browsing views should keep content when they lose focus

Lines.Line: - team view(s) probably don't act as selection provider at all
- TH view doesn't send the very first initial selection. Once the view is open
and F4 is pressed again the selection is sent and the browsing views correctly

Bug.WithStack:
Version: 3.1.0 Build id: 200411240800
Usability bug
I am working with the Java browsing view with the 'Projects', 'Packages', 'Types' and 'Members' views and have several other views configured as fast views. Whenever I open one of the other views (i.e. 'Synchronize'), the 'Packages', 'Types' and 'Members' views are emptied because (I guess) the 'Projects' view loses its selection. I would be nice if the content of these views could be persisted until next time the 'Projects' view actually changes its selection.
Another case is if I open the Type Hierarchy on one of the types in the 'Types' view. The new view opens, but the 'Types' view (along with the other browsing views) is emptied, so I lose my context and have to select the project and package again if I want to browse to another type in the same package. dani, please comment >(I guess) the 'Projects' view loses its selection. Sorry wrong guess ;-) The browsing views track the selection.
- team view(s) probably don't act as selection provider at all - TH view doesn't send the very first initial selection. Once the view is open and F4 is pressed again the selection is sent and the browsing views correctly update.
Sending back to Martin to fix the type hierarchy view. After that it can be sent to Platform-Team.
fixed the type hierarchy problem > 20050517
moving to team The problem is that the synchronize view does not contain a selection that adapts to IResource. The reason for this is that we want to use objectContributions in the view but we do not want to have IResource based contributions as these may assume that the resource exists locally which is not the case in the sync view.
So, the behavior of the Java views is the same for selections in the Sync view and in the Bookmarks view (i.e. the views are emptied). I am returning this to JDT to consider having the Java views in question track the last selection that contained Java elements as opposed to every selection whether it contains Java elements or not. Another alternative would be to track the Projects view selection when the current selection does not contain Java elements. See also bug 73744. The Task, Problems and Bookmark view aren't handled correctly because the browsing views don't unpack markers and there's no Java element adapter on IMarker. Just fixed this now i.e. it will track the selection in those views.
This however does not address all concerns (see also bug 73744).
The best might be to add another option to the view menu: [ ] Link With View which would be like the already 'Link With Editor' option
*** Bug 73744 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Currently now action planned. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [launcher] Eclipse launcher does not follow symlinks
Bug.WithStack:
A reasonable use case is as follows:
1. Install Eclipse as root in /usr/eclipse-3.0 2. ln -s /usr/eclipse-3.0/eclipse /usr/bin/eclipse 3. Run 'eclipse' as a user
This fails because the launcher cannot find the file 'startup.jar'. It would be more useful to have the launcher detect that the eclipse executable is a symlink, and follow it to find the install directory. It was noted on IRC that using readlink() on /proc/self/exe might be the easiest way to fix this bug. This should be a pretty easy fix... Created attachment 31323 Patch
Here's a patch that users readlink() to adress the problem, updating the path to startup.jar and also the launcher executable itself. Could you look it over and let me know if this looks reasonable?
Thanks, Igor Created attachment 31329 Patch 2
I updated the patch to take out some debug statements and make the formatting conform to the style used in the code.
Igor Created attachment 34096 Patch with some fixes
Hi Billy,
I've uploaded a fixed up patch. We've been using this patch in FC for the past couple of months and it works well. Any news on commiting this? *** Bug 149432 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Moving to equinox / fwk where launcher bug now belongs. Andrew, has this been fixed in the new launcher? Should it be fixed for 3.3? The new launcher does resolve symlinks, but it is more than one level. The use case at the beginning of this bug works.
However, looking in the patch itself, there seems to be a second use case that does not work: /usr/bin/eclipse -> /usr/share/eclipse3.3/eclipse /usr/share/eclipse3.3/eclipse -> /usr/lib/eclipse
Can someone from Redhat comment on this?
We actually don't use either case anymore. Right now we install eclipse to /usr/share/eclipse/ but for FHS compliance we can't have arch specificic binaries in /usr/share/. This includes the second case mentioned in comment #9 where there is a symlink from /usr/share/ to a binary in /usr/lib{,64}/.
To get around this problem, the eclipse binrary is patched to always load from /usr/share/eclipse/ and it is installed directly in /usr/bin/. I would like to make a patch that allows people to set a compile flag to choose an absolute path location for the launcher to load eclipse from but I haven't found the time yet.
As far as this bug is concerned, I think it should be closed and I can open a new one for the requested feature mentioned above. Cheers, Ben Unforturnately for me, Andrew Niefer's use case is exactly the reason I voted for this bug.
I (want to) have /usr/local/bin/eclipse pointing to /opt/eclipse/eclipse, where /opt/eclipse points to /opt/eclipse-SDK-3.2.1. (In reply to comment #11) > Unforturnately for me, Andrew Niefer's use case is exactly the reason I voted > for this bug. > > I (want to) have /usr/local/bin/eclipse pointing to /opt/eclipse/eclipse, where > /opt/eclipse points to /opt/eclipse-SDK-3.2.1.
OK sorry. I guess the bug should stay open for your use case :)
Johan, your case works. Comment #9 is slightly different, the executable is in a different location from the rest of the eclipse install.
Note that eclipse can run with the executable in another location, it just requires some arguments. Something like /usr/bin/eclipse --launcher.library /usr/lib/eclipse_1009.so -startup /usr/share/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v2007.jar
Marking as fixed
